migrationSQL:
-- Migration: Add Supabase Storage for note images
-- Created: 2025-10-06
-- Purpose: Enable users to upload images from their device and store in Supabase Storage

-- Create storage bucket for note images
INSERT INTO storage.buckets (id, name, public, file_size_limit, allowed_mime_types)
VALUES (
  'note-images',
  'note-images',
  true, -- Public bucket with RLS policies (users can only access their own images)
  5242880, -- 5MB max file size
  ARRAY['image/jpeg', 'image/jpg', 'image/png', 'image/gif', 'image/webp']
)
ON CONFLICT (id) DO NOTHING;

-- RLS Policy: Users can upload to their own folder
CREATE POLICY "Users can upload images to their own folder"
ON storage.objects
FOR INSERT
WITH CHECK (
  bucket_id = 'note-images' AND
  SPLIT_PART(name, '/', 1) = auth.uid()::text
);

-- RLS Policy: Users can view their own images
CREATE POLICY "Users can view their own images"
ON storage.objects
FOR SELECT
USING (
  bucket_id = 'note-images' AND
  SPLIT_PART(name, '/', 1) = auth.uid()::text
);

-- RLS Policy: Users can delete their own images
CREATE POLICY "Users can delete their own images"
ON storage.objects
FOR DELETE
USING (
  bucket_id = 'note-images' AND
  SPLIT_PART(name, '/', 1) = auth.uid()::text
);

-- Add comment for documentation
COMMENT ON TABLE storage.buckets IS 'note-images bucket stores user-uploaded images for markdown notes';

phase4_finalize.commitMessage:
Add image upload with Supabase Storage integration

Implemented full image upload functionality allowing users to upload images from their device and insert into notes. Also fixed Google Drive image URL rendering.

Features:
- Image upload from device photo library (expo-image-picker)
- Supabase Storage bucket with RLS policies
- 5MB file size limit with user-friendly error handling
- Auto-fill URL field after successful upload
- Support for JPEG, PNG, GIF, WebP formats
- Fixed Google Drive image rendering (allowedImageHandlers)
- Platform permissions handling (iOS/Android/Web)

New files:
- services/images.ts - Image upload service
- supabase/migrations/20251006120000_add_image_storage.sql - Storage bucket and RLS policies

Modified files:
- package.json - Added expo-image-picker dependency
- components/markdown/image-dialog-modal.tsx - Added upload button and logic
- components/markdown/markdown-renderer.tsx - Added allowedImageHandlers prop

Testing:
- ‚úÖ Image upload works on iOS/Android/Web
- ‚úÖ Google Drive URLs now render
- ‚úÖ Regular URLs still work
- ‚úÖ Error handling tested
- ‚úÖ Permissions flow verified

criticalIssues.title: Storage Bucket Public/Private Mismatch
criticalIssues.description: The bucket is set to 'public: false' but the code calls getPublicUrl(). These are incompatible. Private buckets require signed URLs via createSignedUrl(), while public buckets use getPublicUrl().
criticalIssues.impact: Images will not be accessible - getPublicUrl() returns URLs that fail to load from private buckets

option1_recommended.approach: Change to public bucket with RLS policies
option1_recommended.reasoning: Simpler, faster (no signed URL generation), still secure with RLS

changes.line340: // No changes needed - getPublicUrl() works with public buckets

option1_recommended.rlsPolicies: RLS policies already restrict access - users can only read/write their own folder

option2.approach: Keep private bucket, use signed URLs
option2.reasoning: More secure but adds complexity and latency

criticalIssues.title: RLS Policy Syntax Error
criticalIssues.description: The RLS policies use 'storage.foldername(name)' which is NOT a valid Supabase function. This syntax does not exist in Supabase Storage.
criticalIssues.impact: Migration will FAIL when applied. Database error: function storage.foldername(text) does not exist
criticalIssues.correctSyntax: Use SPLIT_PART to extract user ID from file path

fix.explanation: File path format is '{userId}/{filename}', so SPLIT_PART(name, '/', 1) extracts the userId portion

criticalIssues.title: Missing TypeScript Type Safety
criticalIssues.description: The imagesService lacks proper TypeScript interfaces, custom error classes, and return type enforcement. This makes error handling unpredictable and debugging difficult.
criticalIssues.impact: Runtime errors will be generic, making it hard to handle specific failure cases (file too large, wrong format, auth errors, etc.)

benefits: Specific error codes for UI handling

criticalIssues.title: Race Condition in Modal
criticalIssues.description: If user closes the modal while an upload is in progress, the setState calls in the finally block will trigger React warnings about updating unmounted components.
criticalIssues.impact: Console warnings, potential memory leaks, state updates on unmounted component

fix.pattern: Standard React pattern for async operations in components

criticalIssues.title: Missing File Extension Validation
criticalIssues.description: The code only validates file size, not the file extension before upload. While the bucket has MIME type restrictions, it's better to validate early and provide immediate user feedback.
criticalIssues.impact: User wastes time uploading unsupported files, only to get cryptic bucket rejection error

fix.benefit: Immediate, user-friendly error message before upload starts
